name: Immunity to Change (ITC) Model
description: The Immunity to Change (ITC) Model, developed by Robert Kegan and Lisa Lahey, helps clients uncover hidden assumptions that block change. It reveals competing commitments and limiting mindsets that create an 'immunity' to desired change.

improvement_goal.title: What is your improvement goal?
improvement_goal.description: Define the specific change or improvement goal

goal_importance.title: Why does this matter to you?
goal_importance.description: Explore the significance and motivation behind the goal

counterproductive_behaviors.title: What behaviours work against this goal?
counterproductive_behaviors.description: Identify behaviors that prevent progress toward the goal

undermining_actions.title: What actions undermine progress?
undermining_actions.description: Recognize specific actions that sabotage progress

competing_commitments.title: What unspoken commitments stop you from changing?
competing_commitments.description: Uncover hidden commitments that compete with the stated goal

underlying_fears.title: What fears drive these commitments?
underlying_fears.description: Explore the fears that fuel the competing commitments

big_assumptions.title: What assumptions do you hold as true?
big_assumptions.description: Identify core assumptions that may be limiting change

assumption_impact.title: How do these shape your behaviours?
assumption_impact.description: Understand how assumptions influence behavior patterns

assumption_testing.title: How can you test these assumptions safely?
assumption_testing.description: Design safe experiments to test the validity of assumptions

supportive_reframes.title: What reframes would support change?
supportive_reframes.description: Develop new perspectives that support desired change

reinforcing_practices.title: What practices can reinforce change?
reinforcing_practices.description: Establish practices that support and reinforce the change

support_systems.title: What support systems will you use?
support_systems.description: Identify support systems and resources for sustaining change
